questions.question: Coordinator: Gary (1) __________
(4) __________ Street first floor, room T347
Time: Thursday morning at (5) __________
Recommended website: The perfect (6) __________
Tuning guitars using an app or by (7) __________
Strumming chords while the teacher is (8) __________
Playing songs often listening to a (9) __________ of a song
Playing single notes, then (10) __________
What made David leave London and move to Northsea?
options: He was eager to develop a hobby.
He wanted to work shorter hours.
He found his job in website design unsatisfying.

questions.question: The Lifeboat Institution in Northsea was built with money provided by
options: a local organisation.
a local resident.
the local council.

questions.question: In his health assessment, the doctor was concerned that David
options: might be colour blind.
was rather short-sighted.
had undergone eye surgery.

questions.question: After arriving at the lifeboat station, they aim to launch the boat within
options: five minutes.
six to eight minutes.
eight and a half minutes.

questions.question: As a 'helmsman', David decides
options: who will be the members of his crew.
what equipment is necessary to take.
if the lifeboat should be launched.

questions.question: As well as going out on the lifeboat, David
options: gives talks on safety at sea.
helps with fundraising.
recruits new volunteers.

questions.question: Which TWO things does David say about the lifeboat volunteer training? (Choose TWO)
options: The residential course developed his leadership skills.
The training in use of ropes and knots was quite brief.
The training exercises have built up his mental strength.
The casualty care activities were particularly challenging.
The wave tank activities provided survival practice.

questions.question: Which TWO things does David say about the lifeboat volunteer training? (Choose TWO)
options: The residential course developed his leadership skills.
The training in use of ropes and knots was quite brief.
The training exercises have built up his mental strength.
The casualty care activities were particularly challenging.
The wave tank activities provided survival practice.

questions.question: Which TWO things does David find most motivating about the work? (Choose TWO)
options: working as part of a team
experiences when working in winter
being thanked by those he has helped
the fact that it keeps him fit
the chance to develop new equipment

questions.question: Which TWO things does David find most motivating about the work? (Choose TWO)
options: working as part of a team
experiences when working in winter
being thanked by those he has helped
the fact that it keeps him fit
the chance to develop new equipment

questions.question: At first, Don thought the topic of recycling footwear might be too
options: limited in scope.
hard to research.
boring for listeners.

questions.question: When discussing trainers, Bella and Don disagree about
options: how popular they are among young people.
how suitable they are for school.
how quickly they wear out.

questions.question: Bella says she sometimes recycles shoes because
options: they no longer fit.
she no longer likes them.
they are no longer in fashion.

questions.question: What did the article say that confused Don?
options: Public consumption of footwear has risen.
Less footwear is recycled now than in the past.
People dispose of more footwear than they used to.

questions.question: Reason for rejecting the high-heeled shoes
options: one shoe was missing
the colour of one shoe had faded
one shoe had a hole in it
the shoes were brand new
the shoes were too dirty
the stitching on the shoes was broken

questions.question: Reason for rejecting the ankle boots
options: one shoe was missing
the colour of one shoe had faded
one shoe had a hole in it
the shoes were brand new
the shoes were too dirty
the stitching on the shoes was broken

questions.question: Reason for rejecting the baby shoes
options: one shoe was missing
the colour of one shoe had faded
one shoe had a hole in it
the shoes were brand new
the shoes were too dirty
the stitching on the shoes was broken

questions.question: Reason for rejecting the trainers
options: one shoe was missing
the colour of one shoe had faded
one shoe had a hole in it
the shoes were brand new
the shoes were too dirty
the stitching on the shoes was broken

questions.question: Why did the project to make 'new' shoes out of old shoes fail?
options: People believed the 'new' pairs of shoes were unhygienic.
There were not enough good parts to use in the old shoes.
The shoes in the 'new' pairs were not completely alike.

questions.question: Bella and Don agree that they can present their topic
options: from a new angle.
with relevant images.
in a straightforward way.

Claws or (33) __________ for gripping

Research underway to find how many days they can stay alive in (38) __________
They consume liquids from moss or (39) __________
They are not considered to be (40) __________
